mim.author: EAB/FJP/TA UABJOCL
mim.name: RtnOSPFv2
mim.description: OSPFv2 MOM is responsible for describing all the parameters of a OSPFv2 router instance. There are several OSPFv2 router instances.

derivedDataType.name: AreaIdType
derivedDataType.description: Ospf Area Id. Regular expression representing an IPv4 address or 32 bit number used as a area Id. Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone

derivedDataType.name: DistanceValueType
derivedDataType.description: OSPF distance value for routes external to the OSPF domain.

derivedDataType.name: Md5Password
derivedDataType.description:
The Md5Password type represents password used for MD5 authentication in OSPFv2.
Alphanumeric characters are allowed in the string.
Regexp: ^([A-Za-z0-9]+)$

derivedDataType.name: ReferenceBandwidthType
derivedDataType.description: Reference Bandwidth in megabits per second.

derivedDataType.name: RouterIdStr
derivedDataType.description:
The unique router ID of an OSPFv2 process instance.
Dependencies: The value cannot be set to 0.0.0.0 or 0.

class.name: Area
class.description: Information related to the OSPF area of this router.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='(@ospfAreaId ne "0.0.0.0" and @ospfAreaId ne "0") or ((count(./Stub) + count(./Nssa)) eq 0)'> <value-of select="."/> If ospfAreaId is set to 0 the area MO is not allowed to have Stub or Nssa MOs below it </assert> <assert test='(count(./Stub) + count(./Nssa)) le 1'> <value-of select="."/> Area MO can only have one area type (Stub or Nssa) child </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='(@ospfAreaId ne "0.0.0.0" and @ospfAreaId ne "0") or ((count(./Stub) + count(./Nssa)) eq 0)'> <value-of select="."/> If ospfAreaId is set to 0 the area MO is not allowed to have Stub or Nssa MOs below it </assert> <assert test='(count(./Stub) + count(./Nssa)) le 1'> <value-of select="."/> Area MO can only have one area type (Stub or Nssa) child </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: areaId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ospfAreaId
attribute.description: The area identifier as an integer (0..4294967295) or as an IPv4 address in decimal-dot notation.
attribute.dependencies: If ospfAreaId is set to 0, this instance of the Area MO class must not have Stub or Nssa MOs as children. An instance of Area MO class can have only one area type, that is Stub MO or Nssa MO, as child.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.
attribute.takesEffect: All Interface MOs are reconfigured. The OSPFv2 routes from these interfaces are removed from the routing table and traffic is impacted until OSPFv2 has converged.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Interface

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='@routerDeadInterval gt @helloInterval'><value-of select="."/> DeadInterval should always be greater than helloInterval. </assert> <assert test='every $interfaceAddress in @interfaceAddress satisfies (count(../../../Ospfv2/Area/Interface[($interfaceAddress eq @interfaceAddress)]) eq 1)'><value-of select="."/> An AddressIPv4 MO can be referenced by only one OSPF Interface MO at a time. </assert> <assert test='not((@interfaceAddress and (../../../@routerId ne @interfaceAddress/../../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/> Only AddressIPv4 MO reference within the same router is allowed in Ospfv2. </assert> <assert test='not(@authenticationType eq 2 and count(./Md5) eq 0)'><value-of select="."/> If authenticationType is MD5, Md5 MO must be configured. </assert> <assert test='are-distinct-values(./Md5/@md5Key)'><value-of select="."/> md5Key must be unique within same OSPFv2 Interface.</assert> <assert test='not((@interfaceAddress and @interfaceAddress/../@loopback) and (count(./Md5) ne 0))'><value-of select="."/> Md5 cannot be configured at loopback interface. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='@routerDeadInterval gt @helloInterval'><value-of select="."/> DeadInterval should always be greater than helloInterval. </assert> <assert test='every $interfaceAddress in @interfaceAddress satisfies (count(../../../Ospfv2/Area/Interface[($interfaceAddress eq @interfaceAddress)]) eq 1)'><value-of select="."/> An AddressIPv4 MO can be referenced by only one OSPF Interface MO at a time. </assert> <assert test='not((@interfaceAddress and (../../../@routerId ne @interfaceAddress/../../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/> Only AddressIPv4 MO reference within the same router is allowed in Ospfv2. </assert> <assert test='not(@authenticationType eq 2 and count(./Md5) eq 0)'><value-of select="."/> If authenticationType is MD5, Md5 MO must be configured. </assert> <assert test='are-distinct-values(./Md5/@md5Key)'><value-of select="."/> md5Key must be unique within same OSPFv2 Interface.</assert> <assert test='not((@interfaceAddress and @interfaceAddress/../@loopback) and (count(./Md5) ne 0))'><value-of select="."/> Md5 cannot be configured at loopback interface. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: adminCost
attribute.description:
Cost of traversing this interface.
This attribute overrides result of automatic cost calculation, performed by default (uses referenceBandwidth in Ospfv2 MO). Set this attribute to empty, to revert to automatic cost calculation.

attribute.name: authenticationType
attribute.description: Authentication type of this interface.
attribute.dependencies: If set to MD5, Md5 MO must be configured.

attribute.name: bfdMonitoring
attribute.description:
Controls whether availability of this route depends on BFD session that monitors OSPF Interface.
If set to true, availability of this route depends on session state, if BFD session monitors OSPF Interface. If set to false, availability of this route does not depend on session state, when BFD session monitors OSPF Interface.

attribute.name: helloInterval
attribute.description:
Hello interval.
Configure same hello interval for all routers in network. Shorter hello interval ensure faster detection of topological changes, but results in more routing traffic.

attribute.name: interfaceAddress
attribute.description: Reference to AddressIPv4 MO that identifies layer 3 interface participating in OSPF.
attribute.dependencies: An AddressIPv4 MO can be referenced by only one OSPF Interface MO at a time. Only AddressIPv4 MO reference within the same router is allowed in Ospfv2.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.
attribute.takesEffect: The Interface MO is reconfigured. The OSPFv2 routes from this interface are removed from the routing table and traffic is impacted until OSPFv2 has converged.

attribute.name: interfaceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: networkType
attribute.description:
Specifies the network type of this interface.
For some settings, this attribute changes the OSPF behavior of electing the designated router, sending of database descriptions, and the content of LSAs.

attribute.name: passive
attribute.description:
Enables the passive mode on this interface.
If this attribute is set to true, this interface does not participate in OSPF, and does not send routing updates or establish adjacencies while the interface is still advertised to other routers.

attribute.name: routerDeadInterval
attribute.description:
The router dead interval specifies the time after which the neighbor is declared as unavailable, if no hello packet is received during this interval.
This value is advertised in the hello packets from the router and must be a multiple of helloInterval. The same value must be set on all interfaces in the network.
attribute.dependencies: routerDeadInterval must be greater than helloInterval.

attribute.name: routerPriority
attribute.description:
The router priority used on this interface.
This priority used to determine the OSPF Designated Router (DR) for the network this interface is on. If two routers attempt to become the DR, the router with the higher router priority becomes the DR. If the router priority is the same for two routers, the router with the higher router ID takes precedence. Only routers with nonzero router priority values are eligible to become the designated or backup designated router.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Md5
class.description:
Represents password and key-id used in MD5 algorithm to authenticate OSPF messages.
Configuration of this class is only valid if authenticationType is set to MD5. Cannot be configured at loopback interface.

action.name: setPassword
action.description: This action sets password that is used for MD5 authentication.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: String to use as MD5 password.

attribute.name: md5Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: md5Key
attribute.description: Key-id for MD5 authentication.
attribute.dependencies: Must be unique within same OSPFv2 Interface.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Nssa
class.description:
Specifies the OSPF area to be an NSSA (Not-So-Stubby Area).
Disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances. Takes effect: All Interface MOs are reconfigured. The OSPFv2 routes from these interfaces are removed from the routing table and traffic is impacted until OSPFv2 has converged.

attribute.name: nssaId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: Ospfv2
class.description:
Represents OSPFv2 routing instance.
Dependencies: If AddressIPv4 MO with configurationMode DHCP exists within Router MO, this MO cannot be created. If IpsecTunnel MO exists within Router MO, this MO cannot be created.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='every $instanceId in @instanceId satisfies (count(../../Router/Ospfv2[($instanceId eq @instanceId)]) eq 1)'><value-of select="."/> Ospfv2 instanceId must be unique between different Ospfv2 processes</assert> <assert test='are-distinct-values(./Redistribute/@routeType)'><value-of select="."/> Only one of each routeType is allowed, STATIC or CONNECTED</assert> <assert test='minHoldTime le maxHoldTime'>maxHoldTime must be greater or equal to minHoldTime.</assert> <assert test='not(count(../Ospfv2) gt 0 and count(../IpsecTunnel) gt 0)'><value-of select="."/> If IpsecTunnel MO exists within Router MO, Ospfv2 MO cannot be created.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='every $instanceId in @instanceId satisfies (count(../../Router/Ospfv2[($instanceId eq @instanceId)]) eq 1)'><value-of select="."/> Ospfv2 instanceId must be unique between different Ospfv2 processes</assert> <assert test='are-distinct-values(./Redistribute/@routeType)'><value-of select="."/> Only one of each routeType is allowed, STATIC or CONNECTED</assert> <assert test='minHoldTime le maxHoldTime'>maxHoldTime must be greater or equal to minHoldTime.</assert> <assert test='not(count(../Ospfv2) gt 0 and count(../IpsecTunnel) gt 0)'><value-of select="."/> If IpsecTunnel MO exists within Router MO, Ospfv2 MO cannot be created.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: adminDistanceExternal
attribute.description: The administrative distance applied to routes redistributed from other routing domains.

attribute.name: adminDistanceInter
attribute.description: The administrative distance applied to routes learned in an OSPFv2 area different from the area that this router is located in.

attribute.name: adminDistanceIntra
attribute.description: The administrative distance applied to routes learned in the same OSPFv2 area as this router is located in.

attribute.name: instanceId
attribute.description: The ID of the OSPFv2 routing instance.
attribute.dependencies: Ospfv2 instanceId must be unique between different Ospfv2 processes.

attribute.name: maxHoldTime
attribute.description: Maximum delay between receiving change to SPF calculation.
attribute.dependencies: maxHoldTime must be greater or equal to minHoldTime.

attribute.name: minHoldTime
attribute.description:
Minimum delay between receiving change to SPF calculation.
Adjust route-calculation timers using exponential back-off delays. This attribute, together with maxHoldTime, configures minimum and maximum delay time between receipt of topology change and calculation of SPF.

attribute.name: ospfv2Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: referenceBandwidth
attribute.description:
Specifies the reference bandwidth used by for automatic interface cost calculation indicated by the attribute operCost in class Interface.
This calculation divides the reference bandwidth by the interface bandwidth. If adminCost is set in class Interface then no automatic cost calculation is done and the administratively set cost is used for that interface.

attribute.name: routerId
attribute.description:
Specified the value for the router ID to be used as a fixed ID for the OSPFv2 instance.
If the OSPFv2 router ID is not configured, OSPF chooses the lowest loopback interface address. If there are no loopback interfaces then the lowest interface address is used. When reset to empty OSPFv2 reverts to automatic router ID assignment. The OSPFv2 router process is automatically restarted when the router ID is changed.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.
attribute.takesEffect: The OSPFv2 process is restarted. All OSPFv2 routes are removed from the routing table and traffic is impacted until OSPFv2 has converged.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Redistribute
class.description:
Represents types and metrics of routes to be redistributed by OSPFv2.
Only one of each routeType is allowed, static or connected.

attribute.name: metric
attribute.description: External route metric of redistributed route.

attribute.name: metricType
attribute.description: Metric-type of external route to be announced.

attribute.name: redistributeId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: routeType
attribute.description: Type of route to be redistributed.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Stub
class.description:
Specifies the OSPF area to be a stub area.
Disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances. Takes effect: All Interface MOs are reconfigured. The OSPFv2 routes from these interfaces are removed from the routing table and traffic is impacted until OSPFv2 has converged.

attribute.name: stubId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.
